column4: hi a question, i m total noob and i got an error: disconnected from plymouth when i start ubuntu
does it otherwise start normally?
mhm i dont get the login window, had to press alt ctrl f2 to be able to login
i googled a bit, and now i guess it is something about my nvidia drivers
problem is, i dont know how to reinstall them from terminal
how did you install them in the 1st place?
via desktop
define 'via desktop'
mhm i mean, with this windows and stuff :) - right now i only was able to get into terminal, no desktop enviroment
!pm | malice
*sigh* when will people learn it..
but can i speak german here?
much easier for me to explain my problem
!de | malice
last time i used ubuntu, i connected a 2nd monitor via analog. for this i saved a config or something in nvidia x drivers
next time i started ubuntu, it interrupted starting at the following 2 lines
gnome desktop manager
mountall: disconnected from plymouth
now i googled and found this link http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1602767
now i googled and found this link http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1602767
but somehow i cant follow the introductions
i dont know where to find etc/x11 folder
so i tried to skip this and tried sudo nvidia-installer --uninstall, but also this didnt worked and ubuntu told me command not found
